subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Ant task with batchtest is trying to run inner class as a test
msgSnippet: ... Yes.  Yes, this is the case.  It will run on all classes that matched your fileset. ... Exclude inner classes from your fileset.
messageBody:
On Thu, 10 Nov 2005, georgealbertfrancis <george_f@...> wrote:

> So it seems as if the JUnit batchtest is trying to run the inner
> class as if it's a Test - even though it isn't one. When I run this
> test as a JUnit test from within the Eclipse IDE, it executes fine
> so I presume there may be a bug in the JUnit Ant Task. Can anyone
> tell me if this is the case

Yes. Yes, this is the case. It will run on all classes that matched
your fileset.

> and/or how to get around it?

Exclude inner classes from your fileset.

<exclude name="**/*$$*"/>

will do. Alternatively use a fileset for your source files instead of
the compiled classes - or use any other method to specify patterns in
your fileset that really only match your tests.

Stefan
